data.title: Nice atmoshere
data.text: Was there for Louis Black. Although he was sick that night, the place is a nice auditorium. Was the first time we were there and wont be the last.

data.title: Nice older building
data.text: Nice older looking building has character, nice for a not so big entertainment function. Smaller venue than the civic center.

data.title: A Real Belle
data.text: Beautiful and historic, it is a great place for performances as there is not a bad seat in the house.

data.title: Williams and Ree Concert
data.text: The acoustics in the Belle are amazing. Seats are far enough apart for great leg (and butt) room. Not a bad seat in the house. Only downfall is the parking.

data.title: Not a bad seat in the whole place!
data.text: We have enjoyed many events at the Belle Mehus. There isn't  bad seat in the whole place. I love attending events here.

data.title: Beautiful venue for shows
data.text: The Belle is always a wonderful place to watch a play or dance. Not a bad seat in the place.  And it is just a beautiful unique place

data.title: Off to see a play!
data.text: If you love any live production this would be the place to see it-the yearly Nutcracker presentation around the holidays is superb! Several dance companies in town have special events offered for viewing. Occasionally, a few B comedians will come to town and perform. The building itself is rich in history...We prefer the first row in the upper balcony for the best viewing.

data.title: classic venue
data.text:
the belle is one of the treasures of bismarck
multiple performances each year, but the architecture is outstanding

data.title: Gorgeous place!
data.text: We saw Craig Ferguson there last night. Great acoustics, gorgeous ornamental gold leaf work, medallions and more, comfy seats. Very nice place. And the show was great too! Parking is dirt cheap and right across the street.

data.title: It's Aged, But it Still Works
data.text: "The Belle" is a lovely performance venue for smaller productions.  It seats several hundred.  It's an aged theater and as renovated, reminds one of older theaters in much larger cities.  There are good views from most seats (and great views from the center section of the main floor and first balcony) and the acoustics are good.  Depending on the event, you can get up close and personal with the performers.  I always like to attend events when they are at the Belle.

data.title: One of Bismarck's jewels. WE call it the "BELLE"
data.text: This building is over 100 years old, formerly called the Bismarck Auditorium, but several years ago was completely remodeled to it's original beauty. and renamed the Belle Mehus Auditorium, after a long time patron of the arts, and piano teacher who taught here in Bismarck for 60 + years. the acoustics are phenomenal, altho it only seats 833 people, it is a joy to attend any musical event or play in those surroundings.

data.title: Gorgeous building
data.text:
4 of us went to a Rick Springfield concert here on May 8/15.  The building is absolutely gorgeous.  Old and rustic and I bet there are tons of fabulous shows that have taken place there.

The acoustics were incredible and the staff was very friendly.  The seats were comfy too :)

data.title: Beautiful landmark
data.text: I've been to a few events at the Belle and every time it's a neat place to see. It's an older building, but it has a nice theatre and great acoustics.

data.title: Wonderful theater
data.text: We have visited the belle several times for concerts over the years and it is a nice small theater.  It is definitely old so expect smaller seats and a small entry.  But the acoustics are excellent and the place is decorated very well.  Great place for events.
